title: @Meddler Can we please get some context on the Eve nerfs?
body:
I'm trying to understand why you guys are doing this, but I'm pulling up a blank. She's not a dominant force in normals or in competative, her pick rate is super low which is also backed up by a win rate of about 51% (which makes sense because she's primarily played by people who are experienced with her) and honestly, these nerfs are MASSIVE. She's already freakishly mana hungry, adding even more mana cost to her kit is just going to kill her potential in teamfights, because her kit is already starved for mana and because her base stats are already so abysmally terrible that it's hard to justify picking her. Can you please explain to us why you're nerfing eve in such a massive way? And (if possible) give us some reassurance that eventually this game of "Whenever eve gets viable we nerf her" is not going to last forever?

I would really appreciate clarification on this, ty for reading.

replies.body:
We believe Eve should be somewhat more mana gated than she is at present, now that Runeglaive's in the game. We don't want to create a situation where she's OOM all the time, but adding some cost (as opposed to the current free) to the W, thereby limiting either its use or her use of other spells a bit, is we think appropriate.

Power wise we also believe Eve's too strong at present in regular (non professional) play. We don't make changes driven purely by statistics (we aim for data informed, not data driven's). Eve's certainly right up there in terms of raw win rate though, with from memory the 4th or 5th highest winrate in the game at present when comparing champions as played by people with substantial experience on them. Eve's got a pretty steep mastery curve, so if her overall performance looks average it often means that her performance when played well is excessive even for someone on a champion they've played a lot (a phenomena also strongly demonstrated by other champs like Azir and Le Blanc who, if they're showing a 50% win rate in solo queue, are almost certainly very overpowered).

>Eve's got a pretty steep mastery curve, so if her overall performance looks average it often means that her performance when played well is excessive even for someone on a champion they've played a lot (a phenomena also strongly demonstrated by other champs like Azir and Le Blanc who, if they're showing a 50% win rate in solo queue, are almost certainly very overpowered).

The same thing was said about Yasuo, who has been at 50% for quite some time.  When is _he_ getting gutted like a fish?

Relatively infinite dashes with 0 cooldown, linear multi-target skillshot that scales with total ad that applies all on hit effects including crit with a cooldown based on attackspeed instead of cooldown reduction, 2x crit chance, passive shield, aoe knockup with cooldown related to Q that's cooldown scales with attackspeed, extended time of suspension to all knockups, 50% bonus armor penetration for 18 seconds after ulting, and windwall to top it all off.

This makes him a utility assassin/fighter/melee adc that can also be built pretty tanky and still do a ton of damage. 

But not overloaded, am I right?

Nerfs would be great for the time being, but at the end of the day, it won't matter.  That kit is a broken mess of overloaded BS crammed into one release.  He needs reworked from the ground up if he's to be healthy for once in his life.

Q is her spammable damage resource and effectively needs to be used as much as possible for her to be any effect in the fight. You add extra mana cost to that ability and there is certainly going to be a revolt. Instead, Riot adds a mana cost to a COSTLESS resource and tells the summoner that now they need to be more intelligent about when they push W. I prefer their logic, as it goes along with their game design of creating choices for the players to make.

Other than that the ability is her entire in fight mobility and what allows her to get in and out of fights. It shouldn't be punished for being used haphazardly in that way since it's exactly what it's designed to be.

Don't get me wrong, that is definitely a choice you have when using her W now as it is, but there is no actual cost in how you choose to use it right now. There's no punishment for a wrong answer because there is no wrong answer. Use it as an initiate? That works. Use it to cleanse a slow after the fight starts? That works too. A good Eve has built Rylai's, so having to use her speed boost to stick to an opponent is a choice you have already eliminated because of an itemization decision. By adding a resource to spend in order to make that choice, even if it is just 40 mana, you implement a risk/reward to the choice and punishable if you make the poor decision. You can't just spam it when it's up without consequence. And let's be honest, you get 5 times the amount of mana it costs just from building runeglaive, so her mana pool is more than healthy enough for this change.

These changes continue to pressure Nidalee to really commit with cougar-form takedowns, instead of constantly fishing with poke from afar. They also open up more ability to evade Nidalee’s attempts to continue the hunt once she’s got her eyes on you.

They're basically doing the same thing to eve, "insert completely flawed PR statement here", and that's why we decided to nerf eve, because with her average winrate, no complaints about her, and her ability to actually still impact a game as someone that isn't thresh or lee sin is too polarizing, therefore, more mana costs, woo balance. buzzword buzzword buzzword

The difference is that Nidalee's toxic play pattern of ''build mana, chuck spears, heal, chuck spears until a lucky one'' is still there. Which, lets be honest, has basically 0 risk included unless you overpush the lane so she has to go cat to clean (and then you get ganked because you have to be near her tower to punish her while she is cougar form). Her nerfed were completly wanted after she centralized jungle enough. Everyone hated her.

Eve inherently put herself at risk much much more that Nidalee. Heck that is why I fear ganking against things like Riven/LB because they have the early burst enough to erase me if I tried. The only moment, arfter her rework, that the playerbase overused Eve was when she was capable of going midlane - back when her AP ratios where high enough. Now a days she is basically the Malzahar/Heimerdinger of jungle, low pickrate, good winrate.

Comparing Nidalee's situation to Eve's is silly. Riot instead of solving an actual problem, its basically kneejerk nerfing Eve because she doesnt have a 39% winrate/0.1% pickrate.
